page.title: 01KINGLASSIE AND DISTRICT
page.content: The area in this 'D' block contains the village of{Kinglassie}with a population of about 1500, and part of the town of{Auchterderran.}Both these settlements developed as a result of {coal mining,}but the mines are now exhausted. However, a huge mining complex is found in the north west of the area at Westfield where open pit and opencast mines are located. Mining obviously has a considerable impact on the environment in this part of Fife but the other major land use i.e.{agriculture}is just as important. Most farms are involved in either arable or pastoral farming or a mixture of the two. The area is not considered as a favoured area in Fife because of the scars left by the mining industry and the generally run down appearance of the settlements.
